titles.title: Child Health Incentives Reform Plan
A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to deny an employer a deduction for group health plan expenses unless such plan includes first-dollar coverage for pediatric preventive health care.

action.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.

bill.summary: 3/5/1987--Introduced. Child Health Incentives Reform Plan - Amends the Internal Revenue Code to deny employers an income tax deduction for group health plan expenses unless such plan includes first-dollar coverage for pediatric preventive health care with respect to any child under age 21. Defines "pediatric preventive health care" for purposes of qualification for such income tax deduction.
